items.text: full on middle, and defended with soft hands to cover
items.postText: Zohair: "Why isn't Shakib bowling?" -- That age-old logic that a left-arm spinner is vulnerable to left-handed batsmen like Gayle. Worth bowling Shakib though...
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, no run

items.text: full on off, and he opens his bat's face to run it down to third man
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length outside off, but Gayle sticks his bat out and plays it to point
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: back of a length outside off again, and Gayle rides the bounce to defend
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: short! Lands on middle, and forces Gayle to duck
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Gayle, no run

items.text: length ball outside off, and this has been cut away to deep point for one
items.postText: Manan: "Hope doesn't deserve a place in any limited over sides. Just too slow, I like to watch him bat in tests but not ODis."
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, 1 run

items.text: back of a length on middle, and Gayle is forced to defend off the back foot
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on leg stump, but Gayle stands tall to block off the front foot
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on middle and angling across Gayle. He sticks his bat out, trying to defend, but the ball whizzes past his bat's outside edge
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, no run

items.text: full on middle, and this time it's in Gayle's arc. He smashes over Rubel's head, but straight to long on! The Bangladesh team celebrate like they've won the World Cup!
items.postText:
ANIL sharma : "Sooner or later slow scoring of other batsmen will be reason of downfall of Chris Gayle

barlow: "any idea why gayle ducked that one instead of lifting his leg over the ball?"
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Gayle, OUT

dismissal.text: CH Gayle c Mehidy Hasan Miraz b Rubel Hossain 73 (66b 6x4 5x6) SR: 110.60

items.preText: In comes Shimron Hetmyer. Scored a hundred in his last outing.
items.text: full on middle, and he defends off the front foot. But the ball takes the outside edge and goes to third man
items.postText: Davo from Guyan: "I think many here would agree with me that Hope just got Gayle's wicket......."
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.preText: Gayle's gone, and here comes Shakib Al Hasan. Doesn't matter that Hetmyer is also left-handed
items.text: full on middle, and he goes for a sweep. Misses, and the ball hits his front leg. Appeal for lbw turned down
items.postText: MahneelMusa: "Time and time again, he has done it for Bangladesh when it matters the most, Rubel Hossain, take a bow!" -- Slow down, friend. Test bowling average of 80+
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: full outside off, and Hetmyer takes a big stride forward to defend
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: good length outside off, and he goes for the cut. The ball stays low, and he misses the shot. Almost clips the outside of off stump
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: length ball outside off, and this one straightens after pitching. Tentatively defended
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hetmyer, no run

items.text: good length on middle, and he rocks back to flat-bat this down the ground to long on
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.text: full on middle, and he misses the clip off his pads. Hits his front leg but impact's outside leg
items.postText: Manan: "Gayle needed to hang around for another 10 overs, I predict a straight collapse to 150 all out for the Windies. They have absolutely no middle order barring the odd knock from hetmyer or holder"
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: back of a length on middle, and he defends it away to cover off the back foot. They scamper across for one
items.postText: sibin: "i feel like you are one of the anti bangladesh fans. the way you comment is very one sided" -- Oh, not at all. I'm one of the bigger Bangladesh fans in our office! I have family in Khulna!!
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hetmyer, 1 run

items.text: good length outside off, and he punches this beautifully through the covers! Stands tall and caresses this through the gap
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, FOUR runs

items.text: good length outside off, and he punches it through to the off side. Straight to cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.text: good length outside off, and the ball stays low! Hope's deceived by the pace too, as he plays a pull shot way too early
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.text: good length on off, and Hope misses the leg-side flick. Hits his front pad, near the knee roll, but the appeal is rather soft because of the height at impact
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, no run

items.preText: Jahan : "If history shows anything it's that Rubel begins to lose his way the deeper into his spell. Let's try not praising him just yet.."
items.text: full on off, and Hope goes onto the back foot. Clips this away to deep midwicket
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Hope, 1 run

items.preText: Anon06: "I remember certain WI board members criticizing Chanderpaul and Sarwan for batting too slowly, and dropped them from the ODI squad (Sarwan also had fitness issues). Darren Bravo came into the picture and scored at 70. Shai basically replaces Bravo and scores at 65. Are we sure Shiv and Sarwan batted too slowly? Seems as though the WI middle order is moving back in time."
items.text: good length outside off, and defended back to the bowler
items.postText: Something for fans of Bangladesh: West Indies have only once successfully chased a 300-plus total in ODIs. They've lost 34 times.
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run

items.text: good length just outside off. He goes to the off side and defends
items.shortText: Shakib Al Hasan to Hope, no run
